issue.title: No example project working in HW-Mode after installation
issue.body:
Hello together,

I am trying to set up the intel SGX environment on my NUC10i5FNK2. I've followed the installation guide https://download.01.org/intel-sgx/latest/dcap-latest/linux/docs/Intel_SGX_SW_Installation_Guide_for_Linux.pdf step by step. Then I wanted to run the sample applications (SampleEnclave or LocalAttestation) in HW-Mode to test the installation, without any success.

For some reason the packages **libsgx-ae-le** and **libsgx-aesm-launch-plugin** crashs the aesmd service so i had to remove them.

```bash
cd sgxsdk
source environment
cd SampleCode/SampleEnclave
make
./app
Error: Invalid parameter.
Enter a character before exit ...
```

My setup and system:

- Linux nuc-playground 5.15.0-86-generic 96-Ubuntu SMP Wed Sep 20 08:23:49 UTC 2023 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS
Release:	22.04
Codename:	jammy
- cpuid:
```bash
cpuid | grep SGX
      SGX: Software Guard Extensions supported = true
      SGX_LC: SGX launch config supported      = false
   Software Guard Extensions (SGX) capability (0x12/0):
      SGX1 supported                           = true

      SGX_LC: SGX launch config supported      = false
   Software Guard Extensions (SGX) capability (0x12/0):

      SGX ENCLS ETRACKC, ERDINFO, ELDBC, ELDUC = false
   SGX attributes: ECREATE SECS.ATTRIBUTES (0x12/1):
   SGX Enclave Page Cache (EPC) enumeration (0x12/0x2):
   SGX Enclave Page Cache (EPC) enumeration (0x12/0x3):
      SGX: Software Guard Extensions supported = true
      SGX_LC: SGX launch config supported      = false
   Software Guard Extensions (SGX) capability (0x12/0):
      SGX1 supported                           = true

      SGX ENCLS ETRACKC, ERDINFO, ELDBC, ELDUC = false
   SGX attributes: ECREATE SECS.ATTRIBUTES (0x12/1):
   SGX Enclave Page Cache (EPC) enumeration (0x12/0x2):

   Software Guard Extensions (SGX) capability (0x12/0):

      SGX ENCLV E*VIRTCHILD, ESETCONTEXT       = false
      SGX ENCLS ETRACKC, ERDINFO, ELDBC, ELDUC = false
   SGX attributes: ECREATE SECS.ATTRIBUTES (0x12/1):
   SGX Enclave Page Cache (EPC) enumeration (0x12/0x2):

   SGX attributes: ECREATE SECS.ATTRIBUTES (0x12/1):
   SGX Enclave Page Cache (EPC) enumeration (0x12/0x2):

```

```bash
    Process: 17822 ExecStartPre=/bin/mkdir -p /var/run/aesmd/ (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)

      Tasks: 4 (limit: 9043)

        CPU: 55ms

             └─17828 /opt/intel/sgx-aesm-service/aesm/aesm_service

Oct 05 11:57:54 sit-nuc-playground aesm_service[17828]: [load_qe ../qe_logic.cpp:719] Error, call sgx_create_enclave QE fail [load_qe], SGXError:0002.

Oct 05 11:57:54 sit-nuc-playground aesm_service[17828]: The server sock is 0x55a7a611a610
```
- installed psw packages:

issue.title: No example project working in HW-Mode after installation
issue.body:
Hello together,

I am trying to set up the intel SGX environment on my NUC10i5FNK2. I've followed the installation guide https://download.01.org/intel-sgx/latest/dcap-latest/linux/docs/Intel_SGX_SW_Installation_Guide_for_Linux.pdf step by step. Then I wanted to run the sample applications (SampleEnclave or LocalAttestation) in HW-Mode to test the installation, without any success.

For some reason the packages **libsgx-ae-le** and **libsgx-aesm-launch-plugin** crashs the aesmd service so i had to remove them.

```bash
cd sgxsdk
source environment
cd SampleCode/SampleEnclave
make
./app
Error: Invalid parameter.
Enter a character before exit ...
```

My setup and system:

- Linux nuc-playground 5.15.0-86-generic 96-Ubuntu SMP Wed Sep 20 08:23:49 UTC 2023 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS
Release:	22.04
Codename:	jammy
- cpuid:
```bash
cpuid | grep SGX
      SGX: Software Guard Extensions supported = true
      SGX_LC: SGX launch config supported      = false
   Software Guard Extensions (SGX) capability (0x12/0):

      SGX_LC: SGX launch config supported      = false
   Software Guard Extensions (SGX) capability (0x12/0):
```

- aesmd status:

```bash
Oct 05 11:57:54 sit-nuc-playground systemd[1]: Started Intel(R) Architectural Enclave Service Manager.
```

release.name: Linux 2.22 Open Source Gold Release
release.body:
Upgraded to OpenSSL 3.0.10.

Added interoperable RA-TLS support which follows CCC design.

Enhanced Protect File System performance and added additional dependency `libsgx_pthread.a`.

Added the Constant Time instruction Decoder (CTD) into the default AEX-Notify mitigation handler in order to prevent the introduction of any additional subtle side channel leakages within the default handler.

Added Mistletoe 3 mitigations to the IPP Cryptography Library to the AES-ECB, AESGCM, and AES-CMAC algorithms. These have been incorporated transparently into the `sgx_tcrypto` library.

Resigned all Intel(R) SGX Architecture Enclaves.

Upgraded Intel SGX Quote Verification Enclave to integrate OpenSSL/SgxSSL 3.0.10.

Added Attestation Library support for Intel(R) TDX Migration TD.

Added Rust wrapper for low-level Quote Generation APIs.

Enabled `SE_TRACE` log in release binary.

Updated Rust QVL wrapper to use native Rust structure for quote verification collateral.

Added a limitation in the DCAP QVL to only allow the user to set the QvE load policy once.

Fixed bugs.
release.short_description_html:
Upgraded to OpenSSL 3.0.10.

Added interoperable RA-TLS support which follows CCC design.

Enhanced Protect File System performance and added additional dependency libsgx_pthread.a.

Added the Constan…

commits.message:
Updates for SGX 2.22 reproducible build.

Signed-off-by: Zhang Lili <lili.z.zhang@intel.com>

Linux 2.22 Open Source Gold Release

Upgraded to OpenSSL 3.0.10.
Added interoperable RA-TLS support which follows CCC design.
Enhanced Protect File System performance and added additional dependency
  `libsgx_pthread.a`.
Added the Constant Time instruction Decoder (CTD) into the default AEX-Notify
  mitigation handler in order to prevent the introduction of any additional
  subtle sidechannel leakages within the default handler.
Added Mistletoe 3 mitigations to the IPP Cryptography Library to the AES-ECB,
  AESGCM, and AES-CMAC algorithms. These have been incorporated transparently
  into the `sgx_tcrypto` library.
Resigned all Intel® SGX Architecture Enclaves.
Upgraded Intel SGX Quote Verification Enclave to integrate OpenSSL/SgxSSL 3.0.10.
Added Attestation Library support for Intel(R) TDX Migration TD.
Added Rust wrapper for low-level Quote Generation APIs.
Enabled `SE_TRACE` log in release binary.
Updated Rust QVL wrapper to use native Rust structure for quote verification
  collateral.
Added a limitation in the DCAP QVL to only allow the user to set the QvE load
  policy once.
Fixed bugs.

Signed-off-by: Li, Xun <xun.li@intel.com>

issue.title: Is the following is possible using SGX?
issue.body:
Hi @llly, can I ask your advice on using SGX enclaves?

would the following architecture using SGX be possible:

Consider 3 nodes:

1. Service Node
2. Enclave Node (has SGX Enclave)
3. ISV Node with API.

The workflow would be: 

1. The Service node establishes comms with the Enclave node, which proves it is a valid Enclave running the previously provided software (presumably using SGX quote). 
2. The Service node, on establishing that the Enclave is trustworthy sends a task request to the Enclave Node.
3. As part of the task request, the Enclave node is required to call an API on the ISV node. That ISV node would be provided with software which can perform the same Enclave challenge as the service node to establish that the Enclave node is a trusted SGX Enclave running the correct software and hence a valid 'agent' of the Service node, which would be sufficient trust to process the API request which may be a state change.

My main questions are:

- Is it possible to function in this way?
- Does the Service or ISV node need to be running the validation within an SGX Enclave to validate the Enclave node?

comment.body: Thankyou @llly. This makes a lot of sense, I will proceed using this approach.

issue.title: Is the following is possible using SGX?
issue.body:
Hi @llly, can I ask your advice on using SGX enclaves?

would the following architecture using SGX be possible:

Consider 3 nodes:

1. Service Node
2. Enclave Node (has SGX Enclave)
3. ISV Node with API.

The workflow would be: 

1. The Service node establishes comms with the Enclave node, which proves it is a valid Enclave running the previously provided software (presumably using SGX quote). 
2. The Service node, on establishing that the Enclave is trustworthy sends a task request to the Enclave Node.
3. As part of the task request, the Enclave node is required to call an API on the ISV node. That ISV node would be provided with software which can perform the same Enclave challenge as the service node to establish that the Enclave node is a trusted SGX Enclave running the correct software and hence a valid 'agent' of the Service node, which would be sufficient trust to process the API request which may be a state change.

My main questions are:

- Is it possible to function in this way?
- Does the Service or ISV node need to be running the validation within an SGX Enclave to validate the Enclave node?

comment.body:
It's possible. Service Node can run either Enclave(QVE) or library(QVL) to validate Enclave Node. See [QuoteVerificationSample](https://github.com/intel/SGXDataCenterAttestationPrimitives/tree/master/SampleCode/QuoteVerificationSample).
Basic process could be:
1. Service Node generates a pair of private and public key and sends the public key to ISV Node.
2. Service Node validates quote of Enclave Node and establishes an encrypted session. There is an example [SampleAttestedTLS](https://github.com/intel/linux-sgx/tree/master/SampleCode/SampleAttestedTLS).
3. Service Node sends the private key into Enclave via the encrypted session.
4. Enclave encrypt or sign payload using the private key.
5. Enclave Node send encrypted payload or payload with signature to ISV Node with API.
6. ISV Node decrypt payload or verify signature using the public key from step 1.
7. If step 6 succeeds, ISV Node now conforms the Enclave Node is a valid 'agent' of the Service node since it has the correct private key.

issue.title: Is the following is possible using SGX?
issue.body:
Hi @llly, can I ask your advice on using SGX enclaves?

would the following architecture using SGX be possible:

Consider 3 nodes:

1. Service Node
2. Enclave Node (has SGX Enclave)
3. ISV Node with API.

The workflow would be: 

1. The Service node establishes comms with the Enclave node, which proves it is a valid Enclave running the previously provided software (presumably using SGX quote). 
2. The Service node, on establishing that the Enclave is trustworthy sends a task request to the Enclave Node.
3. As part of the task request, the Enclave node is required to call an API on the ISV node. That ISV node would be provided with software which can perform the same Enclave challenge as the service node to establish that the Enclave node is a trusted SGX Enclave running the correct software and hence a valid 'agent' of the Service node, which would be sufficient trust to process the API request which may be a state change.

My main questions are:

- Is it possible to function in this way?
- Does the Service or ISV node need to be running the validation within an SGX Enclave to validate the Enclave node?

issue.title: OpenSSL error on make sdk
issue.body:
So I am trying to update my server to version 2.21 from 2.19. Following the installation process, once I reach the `make sdk` step, I always get this error.

## Steps made
```
git clone https://github.com/intel/linux-sgx.git
cd linux-sgx && make preparation
sudo cp external/toolset/ubuntu20.04/* /usr/local/bin
make sdk
```
## Error
```
In file included from /usr/include/openssl/aes.h:14,
                 from crypto/pcl_crypto.cpp:32:
/usr/include/openssl/macros.h:138:26: warning: "OPENSSL_CONFIGURED_API" is not defined, evaluates to 0 [-Wundef]
  138 | # if OPENSSL_API_LEVEL > OPENSSL_CONFIGURED_API
      |                          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
/usr/include/openssl/macros.h:155:4: error: #error "OPENSSL_API_COMPAT expresses an impossible API compatibility level"
  155 | #  error "OPENSSL_API_COMPAT expresses an impossible API compatibility level"
      |    ^~~~~
make[4]: *** [Makefile:147: crypto/pcl_crypto.o] Error 1
make[4]: Leaving directory '/home/admin-ubuntu/sdks/linux-sgx/sdk/protected_code_loader'
make[3]: *** [Makefile:107: all] Error 2
make[3]: Leaving directory '/home/admin-ubuntu/sdks/linux-sgx/sdk/protected_code_loader'
make[2]: *** [Makefile.source:222: sgx_pcl] Error 2
make[2]: Leaving directory '/home/admin-ubuntu/sdks/linux-sgx/sdk'
make[1]: *** [Makefile:50: all] Error 2
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/admin-ubuntu/sdks/linux-sgx/sdk'
make: *** [Makefile:72: sdk] Error 2
```

## Environment
I updated mi OpenSSL version to OpenSSL 1.1.1u but nothing changed. I am using Ubuntu 22.04 also.

comment.body:
`g++ -v -x c -E -` command apparently shows correct info...

```
#include <...> search starts here:
 /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/11/include
 /usr/local/include
 /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu
 /usr/include
End of search list.
```

issue.title: OpenSSL error on make sdk
issue.body:
So I am trying to update my server to version 2.21 from 2.19. Following the installation process, once I reach the `make sdk` step, I always get this error.

## Steps made
```
git clone https://github.com/intel/linux-sgx.git
cd linux-sgx && make preparation
sudo cp external/toolset/ubuntu20.04/* /usr/local/bin
make sdk
```
## Error
```
In file included from /usr/include/openssl/aes.h:14,
                 from crypto/pcl_crypto.cpp:32:
/usr/include/openssl/macros.h:138:26: warning: "OPENSSL_CONFIGURED_API" is not defined, evaluates to 0 [-Wundef]
  138 | # if OPENSSL_API_LEVEL > OPENSSL_CONFIGURED_API
      |                          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
/usr/include/openssl/macros.h:155:4: error: #error "OPENSSL_API_COMPAT expresses an impossible API compatibility level"
  155 | #  error "OPENSSL_API_COMPAT expresses an impossible API compatibility level"
      |    ^~~~~
make[4]: *** [Makefile:147: crypto/pcl_crypto.o] Error 1
make[4]: Leaving directory '/home/admin-ubuntu/sdks/linux-sgx/sdk/protected_code_loader'
make[3]: *** [Makefile:107: all] Error 2
make[3]: Leaving directory '/home/admin-ubuntu/sdks/linux-sgx/sdk/protected_code_loader'
make[2]: *** [Makefile.source:222: sgx_pcl] Error 2
make[2]: Leaving directory '/home/admin-ubuntu/sdks/linux-sgx/sdk'
make[1]: *** [Makefile:50: all] Error 2
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/admin-ubuntu/sdks/linux-sgx/sdk'
make: *** [Makefile:72: sdk] Error 2
```

## Environment
I updated mi OpenSSL version to OpenSSL 1.1.1u but nothing changed. I am using Ubuntu 22.04 also.

comment.body:
Maybe you have wrong customized including path. `/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/` should be in including path.
```
$ g++ -v -x c -E -
#include <...> search starts here:
 /usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/11/include
 /usr/local/include
 /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu
 /usr/include
End of search list.
```

Your send failure is also caused by including path. `aesm_service` from PSW uses prebuilt openssl1.1.1 and `EVP_DigestVerifyUpdate` locates in `external/dcap_source/prebuilt/openssl/inc/openssl/evp.h`.
